title: Apple Inc. stock outperforms competitors on strong trading day
text:
Shares of Apple Inc. 
        AAPL,
        -0.32%
       inched 0.86% higher to $189.30 Tuesday, on what proved to be an all-around positive trading session for the stock market, with the NASDAQ Composite Index 
        COMP,
        +0.50%
       rising 0.07% to 15,609.00 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average 
        DJIA,
        +0.02%
       rising 0.37% to 38,521.36. This was the stock's second consecutive day of gains. Apple Inc. closed $10.32 below its 52-week high ($199.62), which the company achieved on December 14th. The stock outperformed some of its competitors Tuesday, as Microsoft Corp. 
        MSFT,
        +0.38%
       fell 0.04% to $405.49, Alphabet Inc. Cl C 
        GOOG,
        +0.34%
       rose 0.33% to $145.41, and Alphabet Inc. Cl A 
        GOOGL,
        +0.36%
       rose 0.29% to $144.10. Trading volume (42.8 M) remained 11.7 million below its 50-day average volume of 54.4 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights, an automation technology provider, using data from Dow Jones and FactSet.  See our market data terms of use. The record-setting rally in U.S. stocks could run into trouble if companies report disappointing profits, according to a top equity-market strategist at Morgan Stanley.
